warp_hlsl:
shader_body
{
    float2 d = texsize.zw * 8;  // the distance of the 4 surrounding spots (N-E-S-W), where the gradient is calutated by
                                // 4 - 12, has impact on the spreading speed
                                // (wider distances may result in greater differences
    float3 dx = ( GetBlur1(uv + float2(1,0)*d) - GetBlur1(uv-float2(1,0)*d) ); // east-west gradient
    float3 dy = ( GetBlur1(uv + float2(0,1)*d) - GetBlur1(uv-float2(0,1)*d) ); // north-south gradient

    float2 dither_uv = uv_orig*texsize.xy*texsize_noise_lq.zw * 1.2 // makes the graininess of the fur
                                                                    // 0.5 (very raw) - 3 (fine leather)
                       + rand_frame.xy;    // needs to be set to keep an overall randomness

    float2 uv_bg = lerp(uv_orig,uv,0.4)   // scaling the input motion vector down, useful for a lower layer
                   + float2(dx.x,dy.x)*texsize.zw  *2; // important: this is the spreading factor.
                                                       // 1 to 8 are good values
                                                       // (dependent on the distance the gradient is taken from)

    ret.x = GetPixel(uv_bg).x // we will process the value from the previous frame
            - (GetPixel(uv_bg).x - GetBlur3(uv_bg).x)  * 0.02  // this part darkens the most contrasty parts only
                                                               // try differnet blur levels too
            - 0.004  // overall fade to black
                     // the play of the upper two factors makes the 3D impact
            +(tex2D(sampler_noise_lq, dither_uv).xyz-0.5) *0.12;  // intensity of the hairs (0.04 - 0.4)

}
